--- In junit@y..., "Chappell, Simon P" <simon.chappell@l...> wrote:
> The guys from Sun are not always right! (Shocking! :-) So just 
because they throw NPE's around doesn't make that a good approach. 
Sun also gave us AWT before deciding that Swing was a better idea! 
(Of course, Swing suffers from classic second system syndrome itself!)
> 
> I agree that if the JavaDocs say that a NPE may be thrown, that the 
code is performing as advertised, but I still think that an 
IllegalArgumentException is better.
> 
> Simon

Also, when the code declares (i.e. in a throws clause) a certain type 
of exception, it doesn't report the exception...it consideres 
it "acceptable" and documented.  The @throws tag in javadoc works the 
same way. 
 
If none of these exist, and the developer still claims the caller is 
responsible for the args validity, then we're approaching the realm 
of dbc which is also supported by jtest.

Carson
